channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Coronavirus: At-home tests work as well as those in clinics
item.description: A new study from University of Washington School of Medicine found that self-swab coronavirus tests were 80% accurate overall, but 95% accurate among those with high viral loads.

item.title: Liverpool fans throw smoke bombs as they ignore police advice and gather at Anfield
item.description: Despite police warning people to stay at home in the midst of a pandemic, fans have congregated outside Anfield stadium.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: Marbella sees first cases in 11 days
item.description: Britons already soaking up the Spanish sunshine have brushed off concerns about a second wave even though the country reported 1,358 cases on Tuesday and 4,581 over the weekend.

item.title: UK gives £71m to China in just one year
item.description: The aid sums were buried in the Department for International Development's annual report which was put out this week as MPs go on their summer holiday.

item.title: Exercise PILL hopes after liver protein worked in mice brains
item.description: In a new study from USCF, researchers found that three weeks of overproducing a liver protein provided results in improved memory and learning similar to six weeks of exercising.

item.title: Christopher Stevens on Princess Beatrice favourite ee cummings
item.description: CHRISTOPHER STEVENS: No poem ever seemed more romantic than the one read aloud at the wedding of Princess Beatrice: 'I carry your heart with me (I carry it in my heart).' But there is a scandalous truth behind it.

item.title: Eco-warrior says going veggie is pointless and mass loss of species is a myth
item.description: When it comes to radical activism, there are few who can hold an ethically-sourced candle to Michael Shellenberger. But the American environmentalist has changed his mind. Rather drastically.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain wears black evening dress and face mask
item.description: Queen Letizia, 47, cut an chic figure in a black slip dress as she stepped out in Merida alongside husband King Felipe, 52, and their daughters Princess Leonor, 14, and Princess Sofia, 12.

item.title: At last, you CAN visit care homes... but what are the new rules for visiting our loves ones?
item.description: Although Health Secretary Matt Hancock announced the new guidance Wednesday night, council's will look at infection rates locally and advise care homes whether to allow visits.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'demanded Amber Heard stop doing nudity in films'
item.description: Joshua Drew alleged he had heard Hollywood star Depp had a 'particular issue' with fellow actor James Franco (pictured with Heard) and his name would 'cause fights' between the couple.

item.title: 'Football crazy' Prince George 'plays for a local team' during term time
item.description: Sources told Vanity Fair's Katie Nicholl that Prince George, who is celebrating his seventh birthday in Norfolk today, is a 'very good football player' and 'plays for a local team' during term time.

item.title: Sports Illustrated Swimsuit 2020: Hunter McGrady poses in Bali
item.description: Hunter, 27, was photographed by Yu Tsai in Bali, Indonesia, for her fourth appearance in the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit issue.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham 'building a 3m-high hill in garden'
item.description: According to The Sun, the couple are hoping the hill will prevent noise from the new park as well as keep their privacy from tourists.

item.title: ISIS still 'most significant' threat to UK, says Defence Secretary
item.description: Ben Wallace said an estimated 360 people from the UK who travelled to Syria and Iraq to fight for the terror group, remain in the region.

item.title: Pony thought to be dead is rescued and restored to health
item.description: Volunteers from the RSPCA found the pony, who has since been named Heidi, in County Durham in April 2018. The pony is now thriving and healthy thanks to their rescue efforts.

item.title: Amber Heard shares supportive message from fan amid trial
item.description: The actress, who has accused Depp, 57, of verbal and physical abuse, posted an image to Instagram holding a handwritten message from a supporter, Rebecca.

item.title: Brazil President Bolsonaro tests positive for the coronavirus for a third time
item.description: Brazil President Jair Bolsonaro has tested positive three times for the coronavirus in a span of three weeks. His latest positive result was announced by the government Wednesday.

item.title: Rolling Stones release unheard 1974 track with Jimmy Page
item.description: The Rolling Stones released a previously unheard track, which they collaborated on with Jimmy Page, titled Scarlet on Wednesday.

item.title: Security camera shows 'ghost cat' following feline friend
item.description: Juliette Bird, 53, and her housemate Deanna Crawte, 28, realised security footage for their home in Essex from July 13 appeared to show a ghostly cat following their neighbour's pet Topsy.

item.title: Airbnb co-founder says travel as we knew it will NEVER return
item.description: 'Travel has changed forever,' Brian Chesky told Yahoo Finance in an interview published on Tuesday. 'The world of travel as we knew it in January is never coming back.'

item.title: Coronavirus US: Daily deaths top 1,000 for first time since May
item.description: The increase in daily deaths on Tuesday marked the first time fatalities have surpassed the 1,000 mark in the United States since May 29 when 1,179 were recorded.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 79 new fatalities in daily death toll
item.description: Statistics show another 10 deaths have happened in NHS England hospitals, with one more in Wales and none in either Scotland or Northern Ireland.

item.title: Where is YOUR town on the UK coronavirus recovery index?
item.description: A think-tank has produced a nationwide league table of UK town centres based on their current footfall compared to pre-lockdown levels, which shows London at the bottom.

item.title: Government could introduce 'regional' air bridges
item.description: Portugal and the Maldives could seen be added to the list of destinations English passengers can travel to quarantine free. It comes amid talk of 'regional' air bridges with certain countries.

item.title: UK and US agree to amend 'anomaly' that allowed Harry Dunn 'killer' Anne Sacoolas to flee Britain
item.description: Harry Dunn's mother Charlotte Charles said it was a 'huge step forward' and meant this would 'never happen to another family again.

item.title: Coronavirus Israel: Doctor gets diagnosed with infection TWICE
item.description: The female doctor, who was working at the Sheba Medical Center in the city of Ramat Gan, near Tel Aviv, had reportedly recovered after being diagnosed in April but has tested positive again.

item.title: Black bear seen sniffing hikers in Mexico seen playing AGAIN
item.description: New video posted to the internet on Tuesday shows the curious creature approaching the pedestrian not far from the Chipinque Ecological Park in San Pedro Garza García.

item.title: Inquests into deaths of women treated by rogue breast surgeon
item.description: Ian Paterson, 62, is currently serving 20 years in jail for 17 counts of wounding with intent on ten victims. The deaths of Judith Bruce, 47, Christine Gould, 56, Lindsey Phipps, 57, are being examined.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'husband' Scott Borgerson caring for dog
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'husband' Scott Borgerson was seen for the first time since her arrest at the home they shared outside of Boston on Tuesday, DailyMail.com photos show.

item.title: Throw the ball! Dopey dog tries to play 'fetch' with a statue after mistaking it for a human
item.description: Springer spaniel Chester tried to play fetch with a fisherman statue on July 14 at Watchet Harbour, Somerset. Owner Debby Taylor said it was not the first time he had mistaken a statue for a human.

item.title: Boeing's 737 MAX won't fly again until 2021 due to regulations
item.description: Grounded Boeing 737 MAX planes won't likely fly again until 2021 due to unfinished regulatory work and approvals needed by carriers using the jet which was faulted in two crashes that killed 346 people.

item.title: UK Government copies Trump attacking journalists on Twitter
item.description: UK health officials have lashed out at a number of credible outlets and reporters on Twitter, branding their stories 'false', 'inaccurate', 'misleading' and 'complete fabrications'.

item.title: Human rights lawyer killed by train after lying down on tracks
item.description: Michael Clarke, 61, described as a 'passionate' lawyer by colleagues at the Equality and Human Rights Commission, died near Heath High Level station in Cardiff on July 13.

item.title: Amber Heard accused of lying about Johnny Depp attack
item.description: Ms Heard alleges that Mr Depp also ripped her shirt and left her with a 'busted' lip and a 'lump' on the back of her head on Thanksgiving in November 2015.

item.title: Donald Trump's UK ambassador accused of racism and sexism
item.description: President Donald Trump's ambassador to the United Kingdom Woody Johnson IV was accused of making racist and sexist comments to staff, which reported his statements to investigators.

item.title: 'Mother' is arrested for murder of baby by 'cutting its throat' at Wembley home
item.description: Police officers and the London Ambulance Service were called to an address in Wembley, north-west London, at approximately 9.51am today to a report of an injured infant.

item.title: Kim Kardashian says 'her family is powerless' as she speaks about Kanye West's mental health battles
item.description: Kim Kardashian took to Instagram Wednesday morning following husband Kanye West's late night Twitter meltdown Tuesday.

item.title: Incredible NASA photos from Mars 'remastered' in ultra HD
item.description: British YouTubers ElderFox Documentaries have taken thousands of pictures and converted them into ultra high definition for a 'world first' view of the Red Planet.

item.title: Flat shown after Johnny Depp 'threw a phone at Amber Heard'
item.description: The images were taken by a friend of Heard's and show glass shattered all over the floor at the LA penthouse she shared with Depp.

item.title: Police ammunition found on A13 in London fell off car roof
item.description: A Met Police officer 'has been spoken to' after accidentally leaving ammunition on the roof of an armed response car, which fell on to the A13 near Plaistow, Newham in East London this morning.

item.title: Airborne coronavirus CAN infect people, study suggests
item.description: A University of Nebraska study suggests that what many scientists have feared: the virus can travel in fine aerosols that leave the mouth and nose when people are just speaking or breathing normally.

item.title: Princess Beatrice's wedding dress decided on 'at last minute'
item.description: The Queen, 94, was 'touched' by Princess Beatrice's, 31, 'last minute request' to borrow a gown to wear for her secret wedding in Windsor last week, sources told People magazine.

item.title: Waitrose and Co-op Wiltshire ham has nearly SEVEN times the cancer-causing nitrites as other meats
item.description: A new food science study has discovered Wiltshire Ham has seven times the nitrite content of some types of bacon. It has prompted experts to question if the meat curing process should stop

item.title: New dad slammed for wanting breastfeeding wife to 'cover up'
item.description: The new dad complained on Reddit that he is uncomfortable with his wife breastfeeding openly in public.

item.title: More than 150 migrants brought ashore from the Channel
item.description: Border Force intercepted 13 boats between 5.50am and 12.30pm off the coast of Kent yesterday, carrying a total of 159 people - and at least three young children were among the group.

item.title: Ancient foxes gorged on leftovers 42,000 years ago just like today
item.description: And because the diets of ancient foxes were influenced by humans, these small carnivores might be tracers of human activity over time.

item.title: Dog breeder who had 14 stolen from farm says it's like 'losing her children'
item.description: Justine Watts, 47, a licensed dog breeder from Norfolk, was devastated when 14 dogs were stolen from her property over lockdown and told This Morning it was like 'losing one of her children'.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn to be sued over criticism of Labour libel deal
item.description: Mr Corbyn, who quit after five tumultuous years in charge led to election humiliation in December, said the decision to settle was 'disappointing' and 'a political decision' this afternoon.

item.title: Actress and jazz singer Annie Ross dies aged 89
item.description: Annie Ross passed away at her home in Manhattan, New York, on Tuesday at the age of 89 after suffering emphysema and heart disease, according to her manager Jim Coleman.

item.title: 1,000-year-old 'Robin Hood' Sherwood Forest oak tree vandalised
item.description: Yobs are believed to have broken off a three-foot chunk of bark by climbing on the ancient Major Oak in Sherwood Forest near Edwinstowe village in Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Boxer James Hawley dropped by MTK Global after vile homophobic rant on TikTok
item.description: James Hawley has faced huge criticism on social media since the video, shared by Drag Race UK star Baga Chipz on Wednesday, showed the 21-year-old going on an extended rant.

item.title: Hidden Picasso sketch is found beneath his 'Still Life' masterpiece
item.description: The sketch, which appears to show a pitcher, cup and newspaper resting on a chair, was scribbled on the back of the canvas used by Pablo Picasso (pictured) for his 1922 Still Life piece.

item.title: Dame Vivienne Westwood calls Victoria Derbyshire a 'moron'
item.description: Dame Vivienne Westwood took fire at BBC presenter Victoria Derbyshire today after she was accused of talking 'absolute nonsense' during an interview about the extradition of Julian Assange to the U.S.

item.title: Scientist admits bisexuality exists in U-turn from 2005 study
item.description: Fifteen years after a controversial report, Dr Gerulf Rieger from the University of Essex presents 'robust evidence' that bisexuality is not just a label but a biological fact.

item.title: First humans may have reached the Americas 15,000 years EARLIER than thought
item.description: Excavations in a cave in Mexico called Chiquihuite revealed evidence of human occupation dating back up to 27,000 years.

item.title: Ex-Coronation Street star Scott Wright rescued woman and her teenaged daughter
item.description: Scott Wright, 45, came to the rescue of Ruby Bynoe and her mother Simone Bynoe as they were attacked by Samuel Croal, 52, outside Shepherds Bush tube station in west London last year.

item.title: Deepfake video shows President Richard Nixon announcing the failure of the 1969 moon landing
item.description: Experts at Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) created the video draw attention to the risk deepfakes pose and how they can manipulate people and spread fake news.

item.title: Teenage girl hailed a hero for killing two Taliban extremists
item.description: Qamar Gul, thought to be aged 16, shot dead two Taliban fighters and wounded several more after they dragged her parents from their home in Ghor province and killed them.

item.title: Sadiq Khan accused of 'mismanaging TFL finances' as he asks for MORE taxpayer cash for London
item.description: He told MPs today London was the only major Western capital which did not receive regular funding for transport and asked for cash to provide 'long-term sustainability'.

item.title: BBC Radio earmarks £12m for 'diverse and inclusive' content
item.description: BBC Radio has announced it will earmark £12 million for diverse and inclusive content across all their platforms. The money will come out of its existing budget and will be spent over three years

item.title: Coronavirus fears exploited by criminals to launch malicious attacks
item.description: A new report by cybersecurity firm McAfee found that around the world there had been 375 new threats per minute on average during the pandemic and lockdown.
item.media:description: Security analysts warned of a surge in cybercrime during lockdown (Peter Byrne/PA)

item.title: Priti Patel launches review of elected police commissioners
item.description: Priti Patel has launched a review into the role of Police and Crime Commissioners in England and Wales eight years after the position was introduced in 2012.

item.title: Man accused of barmaid's murder was 'a bit sad' after his arrest
item.description: Keeley Bunker, 20, was found lying face-down in a brook and concealed under branches in a park in Tamworth, Staffordshire hours after she was reported missing last year.

item.title: Woman shares £620 elegant two-tone grey hallway transformation
item.description: Emma Treacher, 38, told FEMAIL how she gave the hallway of her Hampshire home an elegant two-tone grey makeover during lockdown. The project cost just over £620.

item.title: Tatler says Somerset is becoming a magnet for celebrities
item.description: While the Cotswolds has long been known as the starriest country destination for stars looking to escape the city, Tatler reveals Somerset is now giving it a run for its money.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 77% blame children for home-schooling struggle
item.description: Parents and older school children both have concerns about the impact home schooling has had on their education during the coronavirus pandemic, the Office for National Statistics says.

item.title: Coronavirus Canada: Health chiefs recommend GLORY HOLES
item.description: The British Columbia Centre for Disease Control advises the public to 'use barriers, like walls (e.g., glory holes), that allow for sexual contact but prevent close face-to-face contact '.

item.title: Man in Maine cuts his neighbor's garage in HALF after getting into a property dispute
item.description: Gabriel Brawn and his family moved back to the area in 2012 to live at 140 Grove Street, a Dover-Foxcroft property where the man grew up.

item.title: NHS visor workshop among incredible entries vying to win lockdown-themed Shed of the Year
item.description: The 2020 Cuprinol Shed of the Year contest celebrates the best sheds in the land and also includes two new lockdown-specific categories.

item.title: Furious passengers complain of social-distancing 'chaos' at Heathrow
item.description: Passengers described a scene of 'chaos' at Heathrow Airport on Sunday, with no room for holiday-makers to obey social distancing rules in Terminal 2.

item.title: 'Naughty Tory' MP lied to police as he didn't want wife to think he was cheating, court told
item.description: The Tory decided to change his defence in his trial during lockdown after his legally trained wife pored over evidence in the case, a court heard today.

item.title: Twitter sparks fury after locking accounts with the Star of David as a profile image
item.description: In a statement Twitter said they did not consider the Star of David a hateful image and they were trying to take down images of the 'yellow star', which has been used to target Jewish users.

item.title: Chinese diplomats start burning documents after State Department orders closure of Houston consulate
item.description: The U.S. abruptly ordered the closure of China's consulate in Houston, Texas on Tuesday night - leading to Chinese diplomats burning documents and papers in trash cans in its courtyard.

item.title: Prince Phillip, 99, attends first Royal engagement in over a year
item.description: Amid extreme social distancing, Prince Philip, 99, was at Windsor Castle in Berkshire, while the Duchess of Cornwall was at Highgrove House in Gloucestershire.

item.title: South African anti-apartheid icon Andrew Mlangeni dies aged 95
item.description: Andrew Mlangeni, who was the last surviving Rivonia trialist, was admitted to a hospital in Pretoria on Tuesday with an abdominal complaint. The presidency has since announced his death.

item.title: Mugger, 25, who robbed David Cameron's father-in-law of his iPhone 8 is jailed for 18 months
item.description: Antony Wilks, 25, from Ealand, near Crowle in North Lincolnshire, was sentenced to 18 months in prison today for robbing Sir Reginald Sheffield as he sat on his estate in Flixborough on April 14.

item.title: Is a post-coronavirus era holiday abroad worth the risk?
item.description: Most people are holidaying in the UK this summer amid fears of travelling abroad because of ongoing Covid-19 concerns, with f our out of five adults surveyed planning a staycation.

item.title: UK weather: Britain is set to bask in 77F sunshine today
item.description: Much of Britain should see dry weather all day today with the hottest temperatures expected in the South East, although outbreaks of rain will affect parts of the North this morning.

item.title: Multi-tasking teenager solves Rubik's Cube with one hand while playing piano with the other
item.description: Jimmy Liu, from Tennessee, managed to solve a Rubik's Cube in his left hand while playing the Nintendo Mii channel theme tune with his other hand, in impressive footage from July 17.

item.title: Bank Street in Newquay's former financial district loses its last high street bank after 120 years
item.description: A road called 'Bank Street' in a town's former financial district is set to lose its last high street bank - after 120 years. Dozens of banks have dominated the historic street in Newquay since the late 1800s.

item.title: Shock and conspiracy sweeps Twitter after Trump's message of support for jailed Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: Following US President Donald Trump's press conference political commentators took to Twitter to try to make sense of what had motivated him to wish the suspected 'madam' well.

item.title: China is ramping up its military preparation to take control of self-ruled Taiwan
item.description: Taiwan has complained that China has stepped up threatening military activities in recent months near the island which Beijing considers its own. Taiwan's Foreign Minister gave the warning today.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell: Testimony about sex life may be released
item.description: The testimony was given by Maxwell in 2016 as part of a lawsuit filed against her by Virginia Roberts Giuffre and is among documents that may become public this week.

item.title: For rent: Cottages next door to Duke and Duchess of Cambridge
item.description: The £875-a-month and £725-a-month homes are just 4m away from Anmer Hall - where William and Kate are living with their children George, Louis and Charlotte.

item.title: Hopes fade of UK striking US trade deal before presidential election
item.description: Hopes are fading that the UK and US can strike a trade deal before the presidential election in November amid growing claims talks with the EU on a post-Brexit agreement are set to fail.

item.title: Man arrested for groping Playboy model in Californian hotel
item.description: Hayley Bray, 32, waived her anonymity to tell how she was assaulted in the hotel's laundry room while on holiday in California with her partner and three-year-old daughter in November 2018.

item.title: Man, 20, is stabbed to death at hotel in Birmingham as murder detectives arrest teenager, 19
item.description: Police were called to the Crowne Plaza hotel in Holliday Street around 7.20pm last night where a 20-year-old man was found with stab injuries.

item.title: German synagogue attacker grins at footage of gun rampage
item.description: Stephan Balliet, 28, is currently in court in Landgericht, Magdeburg, charged with 13 crimes including murder and attempted murder after he failed to storm a German synagogue last October.

item.title: Earthquake in Alaska: Tsunami warning after enormous 7.8m tremor strikes off coast
item.description: A 7.8-magnitude earthquake struck off the coast of Alaska - putting nearby coastal settlements at risk of a tsunami. Those in Homer, Alaska, were pictured driving along a coastal road.

item.title: VW's electric ID.3 hatchback is available to order from TODAY
item.description: Order can be placed for the £38,880 car - though with help of the Government's Plug-in Car Grant that fee drops to £35,880.

item.title: Kate Middleton's 'emotional bond' with Prince George is reflected in birthday photos
item.description: Speaking to The Express, body language expert Judi James has told how Prince George's arm-by-side pose in the birthday portraits released for his seventh birthday could hint at his future role as King.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: No proof ANY teacher infected by a pupil
item.description: Professor Mark Woolhouse, an epidemiologist at the University of Edinburgh, said evidence now suggests children are 'minimally involved' in the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid vaccine could be rolled out for vulnerable Britons before it is approved by regulators
item.description: Kate Bingham, head of the UK vaccines taskforce, said it may be possible to access a vaccine within a matter of weeks of it passing clinical trials on compassionate grounds.

item.title: The Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh are to travel to Balmoral for annual summer holiday in August
item.description: The Queen, 94, and the Duke of Edinburgh, 99, will travel to Balmoral Castle in Aberdeenshire for their annual summer break in early August, Buckingham Palace has confirmed.

item.title: Government officials have started work on plans for Boris's £20bn bridge from Ulster to Scotland
item.description: Mr Johnson revealed in January his desire for a combined bridge and tunnel connection at the narrowest, 20-mile gap between Northern Ireland and the British mainland.

item.title: Gynaecological cancer charity forced to delete Instagram post due to barrage of transphobic abuse
item.description: Jo's Trust and The Eve Appeal both responded to a trending hashtag #OnlyFemalesGetCervicalCancer, but have faced a backlash from all sides of the debate over the use of the word 'women'.

item.title: 'Cooped up' Meghan is toying with idea of celebrating her birthday outside of LA
item.description: Meghan Markle wants to celebrate her birthday outside of Los Angeles, as she and Prince Harry are feeling 'cooped up', a friend told DailyMail.com.

item.title: Downing Street distances itself from 'Mike Pompeo's WHO claim'
item.description: Downing Street today appeared to try to distance itself from Mike Pompeo's alleged claim that the boss of the World Health Organisation had been 'bought' by China.

item.title: Countess Alexandra Tolstoy sheds tears as she is finally 'evicted' from her beloved home
item.description: Alexandra Tolstoy cried as she was evicted from the £12 million London home her ex lost ownership in 2018 when Moscow judges ruled that it belonged to creditors in the Russian capital.

item.title: Hugh Hefner widow Crystal kisses boyfriend on Mexico vacation
item.description: The former Playboy Playmate - who was married to Hugh from December 31, 2012, until his death aged 91 on September 27, 2017 - packed on the PDA with her younger beau.

item.title: Army of cleaners polish the silver at Windsor Castle as staff prepare for reopening tomorrow
item.description: The royal residence will once again welcome visitors alongside Holyrood Palace in Scotland, the Royal Mews at Buckingham Palace and the Queen's Galleries in London and Edinburgh.
item.media:credit: Royal Collection Trust / Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II 2020

item.title: Felix of Denmark poses with his model brother Prince Nikolai
item.description: Prince Joachim of Denmark and his ex-wife, Alexandra, Countess of Frederiksborg put on a united front when celebrating Prince Felix's 18th today at the Chateau de Cayx, in France.

item.title: Kanye West says he's been trying to DIVORCE Kim Kardashian
item.description: In his latest rambling Twitter outburst, West (pictured in South Carolina) said Kim was 'out of line' and blasted her mother Kris Jenner as 'Kris Jong-Un'.

item.title: Couple fell in love on a virtual dating show during lockdown and decided to move in together
item.description: Crystal Barquinha from Norfolk met Ryan Swain, from North Yorkshire, on the virtual show Dating Indoors, filmed via Zoom, and soon they were chatting on the phone for 30 hours a week.

item.title: Couple with 32-year age gap often mistaken for dad and daughter
item.description: Carrie, 44, and Alan, 76, who are both from the US, met 22 years ago when Carrie was working for a client of Alan's.

item.title: George Alagiah reveals he developed his cut-glass English accent to escape racist bullies
item.description: BBC newsreader George Alagiah, 64, who was born in Sri Lanka before moving to the UK at the age of 11, has revealed that he decided to start using an English accent 'to fit in' at boarding school.

item.title: Coronavirus England: Family visitors allowed in care homes
item.description: The much-anticipated move brings England in line with Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, which have been allowing visits in care homes for weeks.

item.title: Astronomers take photo of giant planets orbiting Sun-like star
item.description: The European Southern Observatory's Very Large Telescope in Chile was used by astronomers to capture the image of the two giant exoplanets orbiting a very young star.

item.title: Lewis Hamilton slams Sir Jackie Stewart and Mario Andretti after he was branded a 'militant'
item.description: The six-time world champion has been the most vocal figure in F1 since the season finally kicked off this month - and he is pushing for more to be done to promote diversity in the sport.

item.title: Harriet Harman opens up on abolition of 'Fifty Shades of Grey defence'
item.description: MP Harriet Harman told on Loose Women the upcoming ban on the so-called 'Fifty Shades defence' to counter murder charges will force men to 'take responsibility' for women's deaths.

item.title: Boris Johnson and Keir Starmer in furious clash over the Russia report at Prime Minister's Questions
item.description: Mr Johnson and his opposite number traded angry verbal blows at Prime Minister's Questions over revelation that successive Tory leaders failed to investigate Vladimir Putin's influence.

item.title: Fertility rates for women under 30 drop to record low in England and Wales
item.description: A whopping 29,618 women over 40 gave birth in 2019 in England and Wales - more than triple the figure in 1989 which was 9,336.

item.title: Robert Jenrick says he was RIGHT to OK Tory donor's £1bn homes development in 'cash-for-access' row
item.description: The minister said 'brownfield' developments were needed to help the UK's housing crisis as he was grilled by MPs over Richard Desmond's controversial Westferry Printworks.

item.title: Two Royal Navy ships intercept missile-carrying Russian Soviet-era submarine through the Channel
item.description: A Russian submarine carrying land attack missiles has been intercepted in the English Channel. The Krasnodar vessel was accompanied out of the UK seas by HMS Tyne and Mersey

item.title: Gold prices on track to rise to new record levels this year
item.description: The US dollar gold price reached a nine-year high today and is currently hovering at around the $1,856 mark. The all-time record is $1,920.

item.title: Fitness writer believes fat people are 'lethargic and lazy'
item.description: Fitness writer Samantha Yardley, 34, from Coventry claimed on This Morning that obese people 'take twice as many days off work' as thin people and says they are 'lethargic and lazy'.

item.title: Coronavirus survivors 'likely to be immune for six months'
item.description: Dr Anders Tegnell, who has guided Sweden through the pandemic, said even if a person doesn't develop antibodies they will be protected.

item.title: Joe Wicks is joined by his wife and children in the last of his video workout sessions
item.description: After completing his final session in the living room of his Richmond home, the Body Coach said he will 'be back' later in the year, after raising £580,000 for the NHS and urged fans to 'keep going'.

item.title: Pictured: Block of flats where woman was raped for five hours as cops reopen investigation
item.description: Hazel Behan, 37, (pictured) who was raped in apartment in Praia da Rocha in 2004, believes her attacker may have been German drifter Christian Brueckner.

item.title: Cardiacs frontman Tim Smith dead at 59: Fans mourn death of singer for British cult rock band
item.description: Tim Smith, frontman of the influential British cult rock band Cardiacs, has died at the age of 59. Smith was left with impaired mobility and speech after suffering a heart attack in 2008.

item.title: Mother-of-four strangled to death by two dogs pulling on leads wrapped around her neck
item.description: Deborah Mary Roberts, 47, was discovered lying face down in grassland with the dog leads around her neck in a grassed area in Wrexham, North Wales.

item.title: The unlikely life hacks that ACTUALLY work!
item.description: Parents from across the UK took to Mumsnet to share the tips that they've been surprised to learn actually work. The tips tackle everything from stain removal to toddler tantrums.

item.title: Biologists search for sperm whale entangled in potentially fatal fishing net off of Spain
item.description: Distressing images show the large mammal completely caught up in the net in waters in the Strait of Gibraltar.

item.title: Girl, 14, is doused in petrol and torched to death by her uncle in Pakistan
item.description: The girl's father Mohammad Yousuf turned down a marriage proposal from his brother Mohammad Yaqoob, who wanted to wed the 14-year-old girl, named Sadia, to his son in Pakistan.

item.title: Hack allows iPhone users to unlock their devices instantly even while wearing a FACE MASK
item.description: The prevalence of face masks worn during the pandemic have made it difficult for iPhone users to unlock their phones with Face ID. A TikTok user's trick has been viewed over 51 million times.

item.title: Police should NOT take the knee, says Scotland Yard chief Cressida Dick who has banned gesture
item.description: Met Police Commissioner Cressida Dick said every briefing before protests included her order not to take the knee to protesters. The top officer added she would not carry out the gesture herself

item.title: Global number of coronavirus cases tops 15 million as the pandemic continues to gather pace
item.description: The top five countries with the most cases are the US, Brazil, India, Russia and South Africa. But, the data shows the virus is accelerating fastest in the Americas.

item.title: Fast food lovers celebrate the return of dine-in McDonald's TODAY
item.description: Delighted punters across the country shared photos of their breakfast meals on social media, tucking into McMuffins and enjoying coffees as they sat inside their local McDonald's branch.

item.title: Syphilis explosion hits Australia with cases more than doubling in coronavirus-hit Melbourne
item.description: Victorians are being warned of a rise in syphilis with 1000 cases recorded over the last five years and eight cases of congenital syphilis in pregnant women

item.title: Boy, 12, runs outside in the hope his mum who 'breaks promises' will turn up in The Real EastEnders
item.description: Brendan, 12, who lives with his nan Lynne in the Eastend after his mum Stacie was arrested when he was four, told how he 'rarely' sees her in last night's episode of Channel 4's The Real EastEnders.

item.title: Homeowners face being cut off as landslip threatens to swallow up road leading to their homes
item.description: Up to 100 coastal homes face being cut off by an ongoing landslip that is on the verge of swallowing up a cliff-top road, a new report reveals.

item.title: Donald Trump 'pressured his ambassador to move British Open to Turnberry golf resort in Scotland'
item.description: President Donald Trump reportedly tried to get the US ambassador to the UK to arrange for the British Open to be held at his golf resort in Scotland, despite a top sponsor previously saying it wasn't possible.

item.title: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry do not want 'a totally private life', royal expert claims
item.description: Speaking to Town and Country, royal author Victoria Murphy said Meghan Markle, 38, and Prince Harry, 35, are not seeking a wholly private existence away from the limelight.

item.title: First-time buyers bought £155, 000 home after one 20-minute VIRTUAL viewing
item.description: Jessica Reoch, 27, and her partner Gavin Jack, 28, from Glasgow, bought a two-bed property in the area after one FaceTime viewing after physical tours were banned amid lockdown,

item.title: NHS nurse is bitten and punched by a patient under arrest in 24 Hours in A&E
item.description: In last night's episode of Channel 4's 24 Hours on A&E, a shocking scene showed the moment staff nurse Graeme was bitten and punched by a patient under arrest while trying to deliver treatment.

item.title: Adorable moment five-tonne elephant has an underwater nap using his trunk as a snorkel at Texas zoo
item.description: Asian elephant Colonel, 29, battles the hot weather by lying on the floor of his splash pool at Fort Worth Zoo in Texas. An adorable video shows the five-tonne elephant use his trunk as a snorkel when taking a dip.

item.title: Mother slams pathetic Center Parcs meal with one mushroom and four slices of PEPPER that cost £10
item.description: Jennifer Carr, 37, bought the meagre meal including half a tomato, half a slice of toast, one mushroom, two hash browns, beans and four slices of pepper at the park in Sherwood Forest, Nottinghamshire.

item.title: Royal Navy Falklands war veteran is reunited with his medals
item.description: Anthony Paterson 57, from Jarrow, County Durham, has been reunited with his South Atlantic Medal and 2002 Queen's Golden Jubilee Medal 15 years after they were stolen.

item.title: Shocking moment 'idiot' boy racers hold up entire MOTORWAY
item.description: A stretch of the M60 near Denton, Greater Manchester, was brought to a complete standstill by the car enthusiasts on Sunday as they clogged up all three lanes, as well as the hard shoulder.

item.title: Image shows seafood lover's liver filled with 'countless' worm eggs after 'he ate half-cooked fish'
item.description: Shocking X-ray image shows an enormous pus-filled lump in the Chinese man's liver, with what medics called 'countless lightbulb-shaped' eggs laid inside by the parasitic worms.

item.title: Obsessed ex-husband, 35, is jailed for stalking terrified mother-of-two
item.description: Company director Jamie Harrison-McDougall, 35, from Eccles, viciously harassed 38-year-old Sheena Leung during a custody battle over their two children after they broke up.

item.title: British coronavirus victims died because the head of the WHO was 'bought' by China, Pompeo tells MPs
item.description: Pompeo's claim that Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus has been 'bought' by China came during a behind-closed doors meeting with MPs as Donald Trump's top diplomat visits the U.K.

item.title: Two French children in burning apartment are saved by jumping 40ft into the arms of rescuers
item.description: The dramatic scenes of the three and 10-year-old plummeting through the air were filmed in the eastern French city of Grenoble yesterday. They survived jumping 40ft from their burning flat.

item.title: Deer roaming the National Trust's Knole Park is shot dead when it turned 'aggressive'
item.description: The National Trust said in a statement that the wild animal had to be put down after it began 'posing an immediate threat' to visitors at Knole Park in Kent.

item.title: Middleman in Malta journalist's murder suffers serious knife injuries
item.description: Melvin Theuma, a former taxi driver, was in critical condition on Wednesday with knife injuries to his throat and torso.

item.title: New rules for driving tests as four-month suspension lifts TODAY
item.description: Safety measures have been put in place to protect learners and examiners from Covid-19, with the Driver and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) publishing a raft of new guidelines for candidates.

item.title: 'Passive-aggressive' corporate email phrases Australians can't stand, revealed on Twitter
item.description: Australian office workers are most enraged by emails that start with 'just circling back' and end with 'hope this helps!', a viral thread on Twitter has revealed.

item.title: Blood test can detect five types of cancer FOUR YEARS before symptoms appear
item.description: The 'liquid biopsy', called PanSeer and tested by Chinese experts, analyses blood samples for tiny DNA fragments released by stomach, oesophagus, bowel, lung and liver tumours.

item.title: Amazon driver knocks three times and yells 'abracadabra' after teenager edits 'special instructions'
item.description: Jacob Staffieri, 13, left hilarious instructions for a delivery driver in Magnolia, Delaware. His mother Lynn Staffieri was baffled after security footage showed the Amazon driver run away from her home.

item.title: GCHQ spy, 39, resigns after admitting flashing to woman from his hotel room
item.description: David McGuire, 39, was arrested after the victim took pictures of him naked at the hotel window near the spy HQ in Cheltenham - but he initially believed she was enjoying seeing his genitals.

item.title: Boris Johnson could create a US-style 'spy list' to kick out covert foreign agents
item.description: Boris Johnson could create a US-style 'spy list' to make it illegal to secretly work for a foreign country while in the UK.

item.title: Crafty entrepreneur spends £25,000 transforming three-storey townhouse to stunning home in six weeks
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Nuala Campbell, 38, and husband Frankie, 43, bought the Belfast home covered in rotten food, sticky surfaces, and urine-soaked floorboards, for £142.000.

item.title: Australian scientists discover tiny larvae of giant sunfish for first time after years of mystery
item.description: Until a biologist at the Australian Museum extracted DNA from larva found off the New South Wales coast last year, scientists had failed to make the link between the giant fish and its larva.

item.title: The 'sanitisation' station Australians are setting up at their front doors to prevent COVID-19
item.description: Australian families are setting up 'sanitation' stations at their front doors to ensure they are preventing the spread of COVID-19, particularly in Melbourne and Sydney hotspots.

item.title: Mum wows after doing a better DIY job cleaning her staircase than professionals
item.description: An Australian woman has wowed the internet after ridding her staircase of marks, despite being told by professional cleaners that they were 'permanently stained'.

item.title: TikTok video reveals the meaning of symbols on the backs of cosmetics bottles
item.description: The meanings were revealed in a video on TikTok, with an 'M' sign preceded by a number indicating how long a product is safe to use after being opened.

item.title: Area 51 photos show mysterious hangar has disappeared
item.description: Gabriel Zeifman took the images earlier this month while flying in his Cessna 150 right along the border of 'The Box', a term for the no-go zone surrounding Area 51.

item.title: Diane Abbott wants Prevent counter-terror programme replaced
item.description: Former Shadow Home Secretary Diane Abbott, pictured, said the Prevent programme should be replaced as its toxic reputation means it is not as effective as it could be at countering terrorism.

item.title: Teen stabbed to death at knife awareness course, court hears
item.description: Hakim Sillah, 18, pictured, was stabbed twice with a ten-inch blade while attending a knife awareness course in West London in November 2019, Isleworth Crown Court was told.
